__e: Not that you care, John, but it's a matter of national security, all right?
I'm supposed to just take your word for the fact that this case involves national security? That's right.
I wasn't at first, but as it turns out the cases he brings are more valuable to national security than what he gets in return.
Even when it's in the national interest, sir?

Having done so... I am satisfied that if Assistant Director Cooper or Agent Keen were compelled to testify, it would expose national secrets and have the potential to do material damage to the national interest.
And then we have you, the new President, issuing orders that don't seem to be in the national interest at all.
